messages.content: How can I establish a connection between ComfyUI and the Auto-Photoshop-SD plugin in Photoshop?
You can establish a connection between ComfyUI and the Auto-Photoshop-SD plugin in Photoshop by downloading the Comfy-Photoshop-SD extension via the ComfyUI Manager.
What version of Auto-Photoshop-SD should I install?
You should install version `v1.4.0` or a later version of Auto-Photoshop-SD.
How do I install the ComfyUI-Manager inside of ComfyUI?
To install the ComfyUI-Manager inside of ComfyUI, follow these steps: a) Navigate to the ComfyUI Folder and b) Copy the command 'git clone https://github.com/ltdrdata/ComfyUI-Manager.git'.
How can I install Comfy-Photoshop-SD from the ComfyUI-Manager?

To install Comfy-Photoshop-SD from the ComfyUI-Manager, follow the instructions provided at the URL: https://github.com/AbdullahAlfaraj/Comfy-Photoshop-SD/assets/7842232/4aa64420-345d-4fee-8f48-c1e92bd42348.
How can I install the comfyui_controlnet_aux extension from ComfyUI-Manager to use controlnet?
To install the comfyui_controlnet_aux extension from the ComfyUI-Manager, follow the instructions at the URL: https://github.com/Fannovel16/comfyui_controlnet_aux.
How can I load a ComfyUI workflow in Photoshop?

To load a custom ComfyUI workflow within Photoshop, you need to first open your error-free workflow in ComfyUI and then convert it to API using 'Save (API Format)'. Save the API in JSON format and transfer it to a folder of your choice.
What is a custom ComfyUI workflow in the context of Photoshop?

A custom ComfyUI workflow in Photoshop refers to a series of commands and processes that are designed to use the stable diffusion model to generate images and videos. These workflows can be saved in JSON format and loaded within Photoshop as custom workflows.
How do I use the Comfy-Photoshop-SD extension in Photoshop?

To use the Comfy-Photoshop-SD extension, follow the specific instructions for each operation, such as Txt2Img with Hires fix, Img2Img with Hires fix, Pure Img2Img, Pure Inpainting, and Outpaining with Controlnet.
